definition: dividing line between distinct realms/boundary/field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: In truth, the only difference between those who have failed and those who have successed lies in the difference of their habits.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，成功與失敗的最大分野，來自不同的習慣。

sentences.english: It is unclear what caused the Sunda clouded leopard to evolve into two forms.
sentences.chinese: 是什麼導致了巽他雲豹進化上的分野還不得而知。

sentences.english: A big part of "eSports" is the concept of balanced play, level playing field.
sentences.chinese: 電子競技的一個重要內容是平衡及等級分野。

sentences.english: The Christian Church is a truly classless society.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒教會是真正沒有階級分野的社會。

sentences.english: Refined ultimately formed the dividing line between the basic literary patterns they get what they want.
sentences.chinese: 從而最終形成了雅俗分野又各得其所的基本文學格局。

sentences.english: Gagra is split into two districts, Old and New, which are divided by the river Tsiherva.
sentences.chinese: 加格拉分爲新舊兩區，以Tsiherva河爲分野。

sentences.english: So we can't separate his creation in terms of the different themes.
sentences.chinese: 不能基於題材分野就將之割裂開來甚至厚此薄彼。

sentences.english: There's no boundary between player and song.
sentences.chinese: 在演奏者和樂曲之間沒有分野。

sentences.english: Darwin's critical thinking pushed the boundaries of science and society.
sentences.chinese: 達爾文的理性思考促進了科學與社會的分野。

sentences.english: The church should be a community of encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒教會是真正沒有階級分野的社會。

sentences.english: In truth, the only difference between those who have failed and those who have succeed lies in the difference of their habits.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，成功與失敗的最大分野，來自不同的習慣。

definition: pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
